message_1: Find all even integers between 40 and 60 that can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers according to Goldbach's Conjecture.
message_2:
Goldbach's Conjecture states that every even integer greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers. Let's find the even integers between 40 and 60 that can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers.

1. 40 = 3 + 37 = 11 + 29 = 17 + 23 (3, 11, 17, 23, 29, and 37 are prime numbers)
2. 42 = 5 + 37 = 11 + 31 = 19 + 23 (5, 11, 19, 23, 31, and 37 are prime numbers)
3. 44 = 3 + 41 = 13 + 31 = 17 + 27 (3, 13, 17, 31, and 41 are prime numbers)
4. 46 = 5 + 41 = 13 + 33 = 19 + 27 (5, 13, 19, 41 are prime numbers)
5. 48 = 7 + 41 = 17 + 31 = 23 + 25 (7, 17, 23, 31, and 41 are prime numbers)
6. 50 = 3 + 47 = 7 + 43 = 13 + 37 = 19 + 31 (3, 7, 13, 19, 31, 37, 43, and 47 are prime numbers)
7. 52 = 5 + 47 = 11 + 41 = 23 + 29 (5, 11, 23, 29, 41, and 47 are prime numbers)
8. 54 = 7 + 47 = 13 + 41 = 17 + 37 (7, 13, 17, 37, 41, and 47 are prime numbers)
9. 56 = 3 + 53 = 11 + 45 = 17 + 39 = 23 + 33 (3, 11, 17, 23, 53 are prime numbers)
10. 58 = 5 + 53 = 13 + 45 = 19 + 39 = 29 + 29 (5, 13, 19, 29, and 53 are prime numbers)
11. 60 = 7 + 53 = 13 + 47 = 17 + 43 = 23 + 37 (7, 13, 17, 23, 37, 43, 47, and 53 are prime numbers)

So, all even integers between 40 and 60 can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers according to Goldbach's Conjecture.
